The institute offers around 51 courses; among them, BTech is offered as a flagship course with total fees of INR 10.79 Lakhs. JEE Advanced scores determine admission to the BTech program followed by JoSAA counselling. Usually, JoSAA releases a total of 6 rounds of cutoff for the IIT Bhubaneswar BTech cutoff and in 2023, the cutoff score ranged from 2806-16386 rank. Also, the institute offers MTech and MSc programs, and admission is offered through the GATE, and IIT JAM scores respectively. IIT Bhubaneswar has witnessed the highest package going up to INR 55.75 LPA during the 2023 placement drive. The top recruiters of the institute include Google, Goldman Sachs, Flipkart, etc.

College_Summary: Situated away from the city and central area of the temple city of Bhubaneswar, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology is a Orissa based prime and private institute which came into existence in 1992 and is accredited by NAAC with A++ grade. The institute has recently received the status of Deemed to be University by the Ministry of Human Resources Development, Government of India in 2004 and is also approved by UGC. KIIT offers BBA and B. Com Degree courses at UG level and MBA, MCA, MA and M. Com like programs at PG level and admission to these programs is granted to students based on their marks in the last qualifying exam. Apart from this, NIRF has ranked KIIT top 20th among Indian Universities and the institute is India’s first QS 5 stars rated university.

College_Name: Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology - [KIIT] Online, Bhubaneswar, Orissa

College_Summary: Naxatra Institute of Media Studies is a prestigious private college in Bhubaneswar and was founded in 2009 after the approval from the Ministry of Higher Education, Government of Odisha. The college offers Bachelor's and Master's courses in Journalism and Mass Communication, Media and Entertainment Management, and Visual Communication. It is managed by the Nabadigant Educational Trust, and affiliated with Utkal University. Admission is granted to students based on the merit of the preceding year’s qualifying exam.

College_Summary: KIIT School of Design is located in the Indian city of Bhubaneswar. It was founded in 2023 by the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology and offers an Undergraduate course in the disciplines of Graphic Design, Product Design, and many more. The college is approved by the All-India Council of Technical Education, and recognized by the University Grants Commission. Admission to the institute courses is granted to aspiring Designers depending on their marks in the preceding year’s qualifying exam and score of the KIIT Entrance Examination (KIITEE).
